**Thomas John Ellis** (born 17 November 1978), better known as **Tom Ellis** ,
is a [Welsh](/wiki/Welsh_people "Welsh people") actor. He is best known for
playing Gary Preston in the sitcom _[Miranda](/wiki/Miranda_\(TV_series\)
"Miranda \(TV series\)")_ (2009–2015) and [Lucifer
Morningstar](/wiki/Lucifer_\(DC_Comics\) "Lucifer \(DC Comics\)") in the
television series _[Lucifer](/wiki/Lucifer_\(TV_series\) "Lucifer \(TV
series\)")_ (2016–).

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Tom_Ellis_\(actor\)&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Ellis was born in [Cardiff](/wiki/Cardiff "Cardiff"), the son of Marilyn Jean
(Hooper) and Christopher John Ellis.[1] His father, sister and uncle are all
Baptist ministers, with his uncle, [Robert
Ellis](/wiki/Robert_Ellis_\(academic\) "Robert Ellis \(academic\)"), being
principal of [Regent's Park College,
Oxford](/wiki/Regent%27s_Park_College,_Oxford "Regent's Park College,
Oxford"), which his father also attended.[2] Ellis attended [High Storrs
School](/wiki/High_Storrs_School_\(Sheffield\) "High Storrs School
\(Sheffield\)") in Sheffield during his education and was a French horn player
in the [City of Sheffield Youth
Orchestra](/wiki/City_of_Sheffield_Youth_Orchestra "City of Sheffield Youth
Orchestra"). Tom went on to study BA Dramatic Studies at the [Royal
Conservatoire of Scotland](/wiki/Royal_Conservatoire_of_Scotland "Royal
Conservatoire of Scotland"), which was previously named Royal Scottish Academy
of Music and Drama (RSAMD).

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Tom_Ellis_\(actor\)&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

Other notable roles include Gary Preston in a hit TV show Miranda aired on BBC
co-side with Miranda Hart from November 9, 2009 to January 1, 2015 , Justyn in
[Channel 4](/wiki/Channel_4 "Channel 4")'s _[No
Angels](/wiki/No_Angels_\(TV_series\) "No Angels \(TV series\)")_ and Thomas
Milligan in the [series three finale](/wiki/Last_of_the_Time_Lords "Last of
the Time Lords") of the [BBC One](/wiki/BBC_One "BBC One") science-fiction
television programme _[Doctor Who](/wiki/Doctor_Who "Doctor Who")_. In July
and August 2009, Ellis starred in ITV comedy drama _[Monday
Monday](/wiki/Monday_Monday_\(TV_series\) "Monday Monday \(TV series\)")_ with
[Fay Ripley](/wiki/Fay_Ripley "Fay Ripley").[3][4] He was also cast as
Detective Inspector Bland in _[Agatha Christie's
Poirot](/wiki/Agatha_Christie%27s_Poirot "Agatha Christie's Poirot")_. Ellis
was the star of the USA network series _[Rush](/wiki/Rush_\(U.S._TV_series\)
"Rush \(U.S. TV series\)"),_ playing a Hollywood physician. In February 2015,
it was announced that Ellis was cast as Lucifer Morningstar in the Fox
Television drama _[Lucifer](/wiki/Lucifer_\(TV_series\) "Lucifer \(TV
series\)"),_ based on the [comic with the same
name](/wiki/Lucifer_\(DC_Comics\) "Lucifer \(DC Comics\)"), which premiered on
25 January 2016.[5]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Tom_Ellis_\(actor\)&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

In 2005, Estelle Morgan, Ellis' ex-girlfriend, gave birth to Ellis' first
daughter, Nora. Ellis was married to actress [Tamzin
Outhwaite](/wiki/Tamzin_Outhwaite "Tamzin Outhwaite") from 2006 to 2014. On 25
June 2008, she gave birth to their first daughter, Florence Elsie. On 20
December 2008, the pair appeared on the [ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_network\) "ITV
\(TV network\)") gameshow _[All Star Mr& Mrs](/wiki/All_Star_Mr_%26_Mrs "All
Star Mr & Mrs") Christmas Special_. Their second daughter, Marnie Mae, was
born on 2 August 2012. On 29 August 2013, a spokesperson for the couple stated
that they had separated, and the following month Outhwaite filed for
divorce.[6][7][8]

As of 2018, Ellis is engaged to television producer Meaghan Oppenheimer.[9]
